thread.title: Hwan Chu Joins Chikpea's Board Of Advisors

author: cnbc.com
title: Hwan Chu Joins Chikpea's Board Of Advisors
text:
ATLANTA, Feb. 16, 2017 /PRNewswire/ -- ChikPea welcomes Hwan Chu , Director of Network & Security Engineering at Time Warner Inc., to our Board of Advisors. Chu is a technology executive with over 20 years of senior management experience spanning architecture, engineering, and operations in prominent multinational firms including Morgan Stanley, Franklin Templeton, and the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE). His wealth of knowledge and expertise designing global, high-performance networks will help ChikPea position our solutions in the SaaS and Telecom markets as we continue to create and drive value for our customers and partners.
A graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, Wharton School of Business, Chu's background in Science and Economics and his experience with startups will prove helpful as we plan and execute ChikPea's growth strategies over the coming months.
As an avid supporter of the arts and culture, economic empowerment, education and science, and technology, Chu's outside interests are an excellent fit for ChikPea's corporate culture.
"We are pleased and honored to welcome Hwan to the ChikPea Board of Advisors. I have known Hwan for over a decade, and I always look forward to his advice, counsel, and insight in the areas of technology and general business," says ChikPea Chief Financial and Operating Officer, Stephen Deason .
To learn more about ChikPea or for investor-related questions, please contact us .
*Started in 2006 by senior project managers and business analysts in the telecom space, ChikPea was created to provide mid-tier telecom companies a scalable alternative billing and order management solution over homegrown or rigid legacy tools. We are the first subscriber retention specialty firm on the Salesforce platform that builds the flexible software tools to allow telecom companies to use all aspects of Variable-Price-Modeling (VPM)Â© and order management to win and gain market share*
